00057 PUBLIC uintmax_t
00058 ccnr_accession_encode(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, ccnr_accession a)
00059 {
00060     return(a);
00061 }
00062 
00063 PUBLIC ccnr_accession
00064 ccnr_accession_decode(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, uintmax_t encoded)
00065 {
00066     return(encoded);
00067 }
00068 
00069 PUBLIC int
00070 ccnr_accession_compare(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, ccnr_accession x, ccnr_accession y)
00071 {
00072     if (x > y) return 1;
00073     if (x == y) return 0;
00074     if (x < y) return -1;
00075     return CCNR_NOT_COMPARABLE;
00076 }

00079 ccnr_hwm_encode(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, ccnr_hwm hwm)

00081     return(hwm);
00082 }
00083 
00084 PUBLIC ccnr_hwm
00085 ccnr_hwm_decode(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, uintmax_t encoded)
00086 {
00087     return(encoded);
00088 }
00089 
00090 PUBLIC int
00091 ccnr_acc_in_hwm(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, ccnr_accession a, ccnr_hwm hwm)
00092 {
00093     return(a <= hwm);
00094 }
00095 
00096 PUBLIC ccnr_hwm
00097 ccnr_hwm_update(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, ccnr_hwm hwm, ccnr_accession a)
00098 {
00099     return(a <= hwm ? hwm : a);
00100 }
00101 
00102 PUBLIC ccnr_hwm
00103 ccnr_hwm_merge(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, ccnr_hwm x, ccnr_hwm y)
00104 {
00105     return(x < y ? y : x);
00106 }
00107 
00108 PUBLIC int
00109 ccnr_hwm_compare(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, ccnr_hwm x, ccnr_hwm y)
00110 {
00111     if (x > y) return 1;
00112     if (x == y) return 0;
00113     if (x < y) return -1;
00114     return CCNR_NOT_COMPARABLE;
00115 }

00118 /**
00119  * A wrapper for ccnr_msg that takes a sync_plumbing instead of ccnr_handle
00120  */
00121 PUBLIC void
00122 r_sync_msg(struct sync_plumbing *sdd,
00123            const char *fmt, ...)
00124 {
00125     struct ccnr_handle *ccnr = (struct ccnr_handle *)sdd->client_data;
00126     va_list ap;
00127     va_start(ap, fmt);
00128     ccnr_vmsg(ccnr, fmt, ap);
00129     va_end(ap);
00130 }

00132 PUBLIC int
00133 r_sync_fence(struct sync_plumbing *sdd,
00134              uint64_t seq_num)
00135 {
00136     struct ccnr_handle *h = (struct ccnr_handle *)sdd->client_data;
00137     // TODO: this needs to do something more interesting.
00138     ccnr_msg(h, "r_sync_fence: seq_num %ju", seq_num);
00139     h->notify_after = (ccnr_accession) seq_num;
00140     return (0);
00141 }
00142 
00143 /**
00144  * A wrapper for the sync_notify method that takes a content entry.
00145  */
00146 PUBLIC int
00147 r_sync_notify_content(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, int e, struct content_entry *content)
00148 {
00149     struct sync_plumbing *sync_plumbing = ccnr->sync_plumbing;
00150     int res;
00151     ccnr_accession acc = CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION;
00152 
00153     if (sync_plumbing == NULL)
00154         return (0);
00155 
00156     if (content == NULL) {
00157         if (e == 0)
00158             abort();
00159         res = sync_plumbing->sync_methods->sync_notify(ccnr->sync_plumbing, NULL, e, 0);
00160         if (res < 0)
00161             ccnr_msg(ccnr, "sync_notify(..., NULL, %d, 0) returned %d, expected >= 0",
00162                      e, res);
00163     }
00164     else {
00165         struct ccn_charbuf *cb = r_util_charbuf_obtain(ccnr);
00166 
00167         acc = r_store_content_accession(ccnr, content);
00168         if (acc == CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION) {
00169             ccnr_debug_content(ccnr, __LINE__, "r_sync_notify_content - not yet stable", NULL, content);
00170             return(0);
00171         }
00172         /* This must get the full name, including digest. */
00173         ccn_name_init(cb);
00174         res = r_store_name_append_components(cb, ccnr, content, 0, -1);
00175         if (res < 0) abort();
00176         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, r_sync_notify_content, CCNL_FINEST))
00177             ccnr_debug_content(ccnr, __LINE__, "r_sync_notify_content", NULL, content);
00178         res = sync_plumbing->sync_methods->sync_notify(ccnr->sync_plumbing, cb, e, acc);
00179         r_util_charbuf_release(ccnr, cb);
00180     }
00181     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, r_sync_notify_content, CCNL_FINEST))
00182         ccnr_msg(ccnr, "sync_notify(..., %d, 0x%jx, ...) returned %d",
00183                  e, ccnr_accession_encode(ccnr, acc), res);
00184     if (e == 0 && res == -1) {
00185         // TODO: wrong in new sync interface terms
00186         //r_sync_notify_after(ccnr, CCNR_MAX_ACCESSION); // XXXXXX should be hwm
00187     }
00188     return(res);
00189 }
00190 
00191 /**
00192  *  State for an ongoing sync enumeration.
00193  */
00194 struct sync_enumeration_state {
00195     int magic; /**< for sanity check - should be se_cookie */
00196     int index; /**< Index into ccnr->active_enum */
00197     ccnr_cookie cookie; /**< Resumption point */
00198     struct ccn_parsed_interest parsed_interest;
00199     struct ccn_charbuf *interest;
00200     struct ccn_indexbuf *comps;
00201 };
00202 static const int se_cookie = __LINE__;
00203 
00204 static struct sync_enumeration_state *
00205 cleanup_se(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, struct sync_enumeration_state *md)
00206 {
00207     if (md != NULL && md->magic == se_cookie) {
00208         int i = md->index;
00209         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, cleanup_se, CCNL_FINEST))
00210             ccnr_msg(ccnr, "sync_enum_cleanup %d", i);
00211         if (0 < i && i < CCNR_MAX_ENUM)
00212             ccnr->active_enum[i] = CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION;
00213         ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&md->comps);
00214         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&md->interest);
00215         free(md);
00216     }
00217     return(NULL);
00218 }
00219 
00220 static int
00221 r_sync_enumerate_action(struct ccn_schedule *sched,
00222     void *clienth,
00223     struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev,
00224     int flags)
00225 {
00226     struct ccnr_handle *ccnr = clienth;
00227     struct sync_enumeration_state *md = NULL;
00228     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
00229     struct ccn_btree_node *leaf = NULL;
00230     struct ccn_charbuf *interest = NULL;
00231     struct ccn_indexbuf *comps = NULL;
00232     struct ccn_parsed_interest *pi = NULL;
00233     struct ccn_charbuf *scratch = NULL;
00234     struct ccn_charbuf *flat = NULL;
00235     int ndx;
00236     int res;
00237     int try;
00238     int matches;
00239     
00240     md = ev->evdata;
00241     if (md->magic != se_cookie || md->index >= CCNR_MAX_ENUM) abort();
00242     if ((flags & CCN_SCHEDULE_CANCEL) != 0) {
00243         ev->evdata = cleanup_se(ccnr, md);
00244         return(0);
00245     }
00246     pi = &md->parsed_interest;
00247     interest = md->interest;
00248     comps = md->comps;
00249     /*
00250      * Recover starting point from either cookie or accession.
00251      *
00252      * The accession number might not be available yet (but we try to avoid
00253      * suspending in such a case).
00254      * The cookie might go away, but only if the content has been accessioned.
00255      */
00256     content = r_store_content_from_cookie(ccnr, md->cookie);
00257     if (content == NULL && md->cookie != 0)
00258         content = r_store_content_from_accession(ccnr, ccnr->active_enum[md->index]);
00259     for (try = 0, matches = 0; content != NULL; try++) {
00260         if (scratch == NULL)
00261             scratch = ccn_charbuf_create();
00262         flat = r_store_content_flatname(ccnr, content);
00263         res = ccn_btree_lookup(ccnr->btree, flat->buf, flat->length, &leaf);
00264         if (CCN_BT_SRCH_FOUND(res) == 0) {
00265             ccnr_debug_content(ccnr, __LINE__, "impossible", NULL, content);
00266             break;
00267         }
00268         ndx = CCN_BT_SRCH_INDEX(res);
00269         res = ccn_btree_match_interest(leaf, ndx, interest->buf, pi, scratch);
00270         if (res == -1) {
00271             ccnr_debug_content(ccnr, __LINE__, "impossible", NULL, content);
00272             break;
00273         }
00274         if (res == 1) {
00275             res = r_sync_notify_content(ccnr, md->index, content);
00276             matches++;
00277             if (res == -1) {
00278                 if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, r_sync_enumerate_action, CCNL_FINEST))
00279                     ccnr_debug_content(ccnr, __LINE__, "r_sync_enumerate_action", NULL,
00280                                        content);
00281                 ev->evdata = cleanup_se(ccnr, md);
00282                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&scratch);
00283                 return(0);
00284             }
00285         }
00286         content = r_store_content_next(ccnr, content);
00287         if (content != NULL &&
00288             !r_store_content_matches_interest_prefix(ccnr, content,
00289                                                      interest->buf,
00290                                                      interest->length))
00291             content = NULL;
00292         if (content != NULL) {
00293             md->cookie = r_store_content_cookie(ccnr, content);
00294             ccnr->active_enum[md->index] = r_store_content_accession(ccnr, content);
00295             if (ccnr->active_enum[md->index] != CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION && 
00296                 (matches >= 8 || try >= 200)) { // XXX - these numbers need tuning
00297                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&scratch);
00298                 return(300);
00299             }
00300         }
00301     }
00302     r_sync_notify_content(ccnr, md->index, NULL);
00303     ev->evdata = cleanup_se(ccnr, md);
00304     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&scratch);
00305     return(0);
00306 }
00307 
00308 /**
00309  * Request that a SyncNotifyContent call be made for each content object
00310  *  in the repository that matches the interest.
00311  *
00312  * If SyncNotifyContent returns -1 the active enumeration will be cancelled.
00313  *
00314  * When there are no more matching objects, SyncNotifyContent will be called
00315  *  passing NULL for name.
00316  *
00317  * Content objects that arrive during an enumeration may or may not be included
00318  *  in that enumeration.
00319  *
00320  *  @returns -1 for error, or an enumeration number which will also be passed
00321  *      in the SyncNotifyContent
00322  */
00323 PUBLIC int
00324 r_sync_enumerate(struct sync_plumbing *sdd,
00325                  struct ccn_charbuf *interest)
00326 {
00327     struct ccnr_handle *ccnr = (struct ccnr_handle *)sdd->client_data;
00328     int ans = -1;
00329     int i;
00330     int res;
00331     struct ccn_indexbuf *comps = NULL;
00332     struct ccn_parsed_interest parsed_interest = {0};
00333     struct ccn_parsed_interest *pi = &parsed_interest;
00334     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
00335     struct sync_enumeration_state *md = NULL;
00336     
00337     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, r_sync_enumerate, CCNL_FINEST))
00338         ccnr_debug_ccnb(ccnr, __LINE__, "sync_enum_start", NULL,
00339                         interest->buf, interest->length);
00340     comps = ccn_indexbuf_create();
00341     res = ccn_parse_interest(interest->buf, interest->length, pi, comps);
00342     if (res < 0) {
00343         ccnr_debug_ccnb(ccnr, __LINE__, "bogus r_sync_enumerate request", NULL,
00344                         interest->buf, interest->length);
00345         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, r_sync_enumerate, CCNL_FINEST)) {
00346             struct ccn_charbuf *temp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00347             ccn_charbuf_putf(temp, "interest_dump ");
00348             for (i = 0; i < interest->length; i++)
00349                 ccn_charbuf_putf(temp, "%02X", interest->buf[i]);
00350             ccnr_msg(ccnr, ccn_charbuf_as_string(temp));
00351             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&temp);
00352         }
00353         goto Bail;
00354     }
00355     /* 0 is for notify_after - don't allocate it here. */
00356     for (i = 1; i < CCNR_MAX_ENUM; i++) {
00357         if (ccnr->active_enum[i] == CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION) {
00358             ans = i;
00359             ccnr->active_enum[ans] = CCNR_MAX_ACCESSION; /* for no-match case */
00360             break;
00361         }
00362     }
00363     if (ans < 0) {
00364         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, r_sync_enumerate, CCNL_WARNING))
00365             ccnr_msg(ccnr, "sync_enum - Too many active enumerations!", ans);
00366         goto Bail;
00367     }
00368     content = r_store_find_first_match_candidate(ccnr, interest->buf, pi);
00369     if (content == NULL) {
00370         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, r_sync_enumerate, CCNL_FINE))
00371             ccnr_debug_ccnb(ccnr, __LINE__, "sync_enum_nomatch", NULL,
00372                         interest->buf, interest->length);
00373     }
00374     else if (r_store_content_matches_interest_prefix(ccnr,
00375            content, interest->buf, interest->length)) {
00376         ccnr->active_enum[ans] = r_store_content_accession(ccnr, content);
00377         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, r_sync_enumerate, CCNL_FINEST))
00378             ccnr_msg(ccnr, "sync_enum id=%d starting accession=0x%jx",
00379                      ans, ccnr_accession_encode(ccnr, ccnr->active_enum[ans]));
00380     }
00381     
00382     /* Set up the state for r_sync_enumerate_action */
00383     md = calloc(1, sizeof(*md));
00384     if (md == NULL) { ccnr->active_enum[ans] = CCNR_NULL_ACCESSION; ans = -1; goto Bail; }
00385     md->magic = se_cookie;
00386     md->cookie = content == NULL ? 0 : r_store_content_cookie(ccnr, content);
00387     md->index = ans;
00388     md->interest = ccn_charbuf_create();
00389     if (md->interest == NULL) goto Bail;
00390     ccn_charbuf_append(md->interest, interest->buf, interest->length);
00391     md->parsed_interest = parsed_interest;
00392     md->comps = comps;
00393     comps = NULL;
00394 
00395     /* All the upcalls happen in r_sync_enumerate_action. */
00396     
00397     if (NULL != ccn_schedule_event(ccnr->sched, 123, r_sync_enumerate_action, md, 0))
00398         md = NULL;
00399     
00400 Bail:
00401     if (md != NULL) {
00402         ans = -1;
00403         md = cleanup_se(ccnr, md);
00404     }
00405     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&comps);
00406     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, r_sync_enumerate, CCNL_FINEST))
00407         ccnr_msg(ccnr, "sync_enum %d", ans);
00408     return(ans);
00409 }
00410 
00411 PUBLIC int
00412 r_sync_lookup(struct sync_plumbing *sdd,
00413               struct ccn_charbuf *interest,
00414               struct ccn_charbuf *content_ccnb)
00415 {
00416     struct ccnr_handle *ccnr = (struct ccnr_handle *)sdd->client_data;
00417     return(r_lookup(ccnr, interest, content_ccnb));
00418 }
00419 
00420 PUBLIC int
00421 r_lookup(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr,
00422                   struct ccn_charbuf *interest,
00423                   struct ccn_charbuf *content_ccnb)
00424 {
00425     int ans = -1;
00426     struct ccn_indexbuf *comps = r_util_indexbuf_obtain(ccnr);
00427     struct ccn_parsed_interest parsed_interest = {0};
00428     struct ccn_parsed_interest *pi = &parsed_interest;
00429     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
00430     
00431     if (NULL == comps || (ccn_parse_interest(interest->buf, interest->length, pi, comps) < 0))
00432         abort();
00433     content = r_store_lookup(ccnr, interest->buf, pi, comps);
00434     if (content != NULL) {
00435         ans = 0;
00436         if (content_ccnb != NULL) {
00437             const unsigned char *base = r_store_content_base(ccnr, content);
00438             size_t size = r_store_content_size(ccnr, content);
00439             if (base == NULL) {
00440                 ccnr_debug_ccnb(ccnr, __LINE__, "r_sync_lookup null content base", NULL,
00441                                 interest->buf, interest->length);
00442                 ans = -1;
00443             } else
00444                 ccn_charbuf_append(content_ccnb, base, size);
00445         }
00446     }
00447     r_util_indexbuf_release(ccnr, comps);
00448     return(ans);
00449 }
00450 /**
00451  * Called when a content object is received by sync and needs to be
00452  * committed to stable storage by the repo.
00453  */
00454 PUBLIC enum ccn_upcall_res
00455 r_sync_upcall_store(struct sync_plumbing *sdd,
00456                     enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00457                     struct ccn_upcall_info *info)
00458 {
00459     struct ccnr_handle *ccnr = (struct ccnr_handle *)sdd->client_data;
00460     enum ccn_upcall_res ans = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK;
00461     const unsigned char *ccnb = NULL;
00462     size_t ccnb_size = 0;
00463     struct content_entry *content;
00464     
00465     if (kind != CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT)
00466         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
00467     
00468     ccnb = info->content_ccnb;
00469     ccnb_size = info->pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E];
00470     
00471     content = process_incoming_content(ccnr, r_io_fdholder_from_fd(ccnr, ccn_get_connection_fd(info->h)),
00472                                        (void *)ccnb, ccnb_size, NULL);
00473     if (content == NULL) {
00474         ccnr_msg(ccnr, "r_sync_upcall_store: failed to process incoming content");
00475         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
00476     }
00477     // XXX - here we need to check if this is something we *should* be storing, according to our policy
00478     if ((r_store_content_flags(content) & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STABLE) == 0) {
00479         r_store_commit_content(ccnr, content);
00480         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, r_sync_upcall_store, CCNL_FINE))
00481             ccnr_debug_content(ccnr, __LINE__, "content_stored",
00482                                r_io_fdholder_from_fd(ccnr, ccnr->active_out_fd),
00483                                content);
00484     }        
00485     r_proto_initiate_key_fetch(ccnr, ccnb, info->pco, 0,
00486                                r_store_content_cookie(ccnr, content));
00487 
00488     return(ans);
00489 }
00490 
00491 /**
00492  * Called when a content object has been constructed locally by sync
00493  * and needs to be committed to stable storage by the repo.
00494  * returns 0 for success, -1 for error.
00495  */
00496 
00497 PUBLIC int
00498 r_sync_local_store(struct sync_plumbing *sdd,
00499                    struct ccn_charbuf *content_cb)
00500 {
00501     struct ccnr_handle *ccnr = (struct ccnr_handle *)sdd->client_data;
00502     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
00503     
00504     // pretend it came from the internal client, for statistics gathering purposes
00505     content = process_incoming_content(ccnr, ccnr->face0,
00506                                        (void *)content_cb->buf, content_cb->length, NULL);
00507     if (content == NULL) {
00508         ccnr_msg(ccnr, "r_sync_local_store: failed to process content");
00509         return(-1);
00510     }
00511     // XXX - we assume we must store things from sync independent of policy
00512     // XXX - sync may want notification, or not, at least for now.
00513     if ((r_store_content_flags(content) & CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STABLE) == 0) {
00514         r_store_commit_content(ccnr, content);
00515         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(ccnr, r_sync_local_store, CCNL_FINE))
00516             ccnr_debug_content(ccnr, __LINE__, "content_stored_local",
00517                                r_io_fdholder_from_fd(ccnr, ccnr->active_out_fd),
00518                                content);
00519     }
00520     return(0);
00521 }
